countries.name: Afghanistan
countries.funFact: Afghanistan is the world's largest producer of opium. As of 2021, Afghanistan is the source of more than 90% of the world's opium supply. It is the source of more than 95% of the European opium supply. Opium farming is a major source of employment in Afghanistan.

countries.name: Åland Islands
countries.funFact: Despite being an autonomous region of Finland, Åland Islands' official language is actually Swedish. The students aren't even obliged to learn Finnish in school.

countries.name: Albania
countries.funFact: Only 3 million people live in the country. There are more Albanians now living outside the country than within its territories. The estimated diaspora population of Albanians is between seven to ten million.

countries.name: Algeria
countries.funFact: Algeria is the largest country in Africa.

countries.name: American Samoa
funFact: In the 1960s, the US spent a lot of moeny to build schools, streets, a hospital and 2 tuna canneries in the archipelgo. As of 2017, over 80% of the country's working population work in tuna canneries, while the other 20% work in agriculture or for the US government. Moreover, 93% of American Samoa's exports is canned tuna, and 100% of the exports go to the US.

During the moon landings in the 1960s and 70s, American Samoa's waters were a popular landing site for astronauts. A small American Samoa flag was sent to the moon on one of the missions, and later awarded, along with 3 moon rocks, to American Samoa, by US president Richard Nixon.

countries.name: Andorra
countries.funFact: Andorra is the only country in the world with Catalan as its official language.

countries.name: Angola
countries.funFact: Thanks to a small exclave a near their border with the DRC, Angola is the 2nd largest producer of oil in Africa.

countries.name: Anguilla
countries.funFact: Despite Anguilla being only 16 miles (25 km) long and 3 miles (5 km) wide and having a population of only 15,000 people, many famous celebrities have lived there, including Chuck Norris, Paris Hilton, Jay-Z, Michael Jordan, Leonardo DiCaprio, Liam Neeson and Sandra Bullock.

countries.name: Antigua and Barbuda
countries.funFact: Antigua and Barbuda was one of the last countries to gain independce from the UK, gaining indepndence in 1981. The only countries to gain independence from UK afterwards are Saint Kitts and Nevis and Brunei, in 1983 and 1984, respectively.

countries.name: Argentina
countries.funFact: Argentina was named after a mountain made of silver, since 'Argentina' in Italian means 'made of silver'.

countries.name: Armenia
countries.funFact: Armenia is the first country to adopt Christianity, all the way back in 300 AD. Armenia is also the 2nd most religious country in Europe, with over 97% of the population saying they believe in God.

countries.name: Aruba
countries.funFact: Every native Aruban speaks 4 languages: Dutch, Papiamento (The official languages of Aruba), English and Spanish.

countries.name: Australia
funFact: The capital of Australia is Canberra, and not Sydney as others assume.
The Great Barrier Reef, located off the shore of Australia, is the world's largest living organism, and is often listed as one of the Seven Wonders of the Natural World.

countries.name: Austria
countries.funFact: The Austrian flag dates back to 1191, which makes it one of the oldest national flags in the world.

countries.name: Azerbaijan
countries.funFact: In 1918 Azerbaijan became the first Muslim nation and one of the first nations in general to grant women the right to vote.

countries.name: Bahamas
countries.funFact: The name Bahamas comes from the Spanish term 'baja mar', which means shallow sea.

countries.name: Bahrain
countries.funFact: Bahrain is an island located in the Persian Gulf. However, it's connected to the Saudi city of Al Khobar.

countries.name: Bangladesh
countries.funFact: Dhaka, Bangladesh capital, is the most densely populated city on Earth, with a density of over 2,000 people per square km.

countries.name: Barbados
countries.funFact: Rihanna is originally from Barbados.

countries.name: Belarus
countries.funFact: Two Israeli presidents were born in Belarus, Chaim Weizmann and Shimon Peres.

countries.name: Belgium
countries.funFact: Belgium holds the world record for the longest period without a government.

countries.name: Belize
countries.funFact: A British colony for more than 200 years, Belize today is the only nation in Central America where English is the official language. More than 80% of the population speak English as their mother tongue. Other languages spoken in Belize include Mayan, Kriol (Creole), Garifuna, and Spanish.

countries.name: Benin
countries.funFact: Benin's south coast was once the 'slave coast'. Benin’s southern coast was a major departure point for slaves for over 100 years. Over 10,000 slaves a year were shipped from here to the Americas.

countries.name: Bermuda
countries.funFact: It's the Shipwreck Capital of the World. Bermuda's extensive coastal reef and the occasional big storm are the perfect conditions for shipwrecks. To date, over 300 wrecks have been found dating back to the 1600s.

countries.name: Bhutan
countries.funFact: Bhutan is the only country in the world where tobacco is banned.

countries.name: Bolivia (Plurinational State of)
countries.funFact: Despite having no coastline, Bolivia does have a navy. It mainly patrolls the Amazon tributaries.

countries.name: Caribbean Netherlands
countries.funFact: The Carribbean Netherlands are three islands in the Carribbean that are classified as overseas territories of The Netherlands. The three islands are: Bonaire, Sint Eustatius, and Saba

countries.name: Bosnia and Herzegovina
funFact: Bosnia and Herzegovina has about 152 unexploded landmines per square mile (58 per square km).
Bosnia and Herzegovina's capital city, Sarajevo, is where Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austro-Hungary was assassinated on June 28th 1914, an event which ultimately led to the beginning of WW1.

countries.name: Botswana
countries.funFact: Botswana Has Africa's Highest Concentration Of Elephants. Botswana is home to approximately 130,451 elephants. Additionally, the country has a density of 1.28 elephants per square km, which is the highest elephant concentration in Africa.

countries.name: Bouvet Island
countries.funFact: Bouvet Island is an Norwegian uninhabited island in the southern Atlantic Ocean. It is widely considered to be the most remote island in the world, as the closest inhabited place to the island is Queen Maud Land, located in Antarctica, about 1,000 miles (1,600 km) away.

countries.name: Brazil
countries.funFact: Brazil was the last country in America to abolish slavery, in 1888.

countries.name: British Indian Ocean Territory
countries.funFact: The only inhabitants of the British Indian Ocean Territory are 2,500 British and US military personnel. Thus, there are no permanent inhabitants in the islands. There were inhabitants in the islands, up until 1973, when the British deported the 2,000 inhabitants to Mauritius.

countries.name: United States Minor Outlying Islands
countries.funFact: The United States Minor Outlying Islands are a group of 8 islands and atolls in the Pacific Ocean and 1 in the Carribbean. One of the atolls is Midway Atoll, where the Battle of Midway occured in WW2 between Japan and the US. This battle was a turning point in the Campaign for the Pacific.

countries.name: Virgin Islands (British)
countries.funFact: The British Virgin Islands is an archipelago in the Carribbean, discovered and named by Christopher Colombus in 1493. The islands were first inhabited in 1500 BC by native American tribes. Several different empires, including the Spanish, Dutch, British, and French, fought to take control of the island.

countries.name: Virgin Islands (U.S.)
funFact: Although the US Virgin Islands are considered a part of the US, it is the only location in the United States where you drive on the left side of the road

The 2nd oldest synagogue in the US is located in the US Virgin Islands. It was founded in 1796 by Spanish and Portuguese Sephardic Jews who had come to the Caribbean Basin to finance trade between Europe and the New World.

countries.name: Brunei Darussalam
funFact: Much of Shell's oil comes from offshore drilling platforms in Brunei.
Brunei is the last country in the world to gain independence from the British Empire, in 1984.

countries.name: Bulgaria
countries.funFact: Bulgaria is where the Early Cyrillic Alphabet, the predecessor to the modern Cyrillic Alphabet, was developed. It was originally created to translate the Bible into Slavic languages.

countries.name: Burkina Faso
countries.funFact: The main export of Burkina Faso is gold, followed by cotton and animal products. Burkina Faso is also one of Africa’s largest producers of cotton.

countries.name: Burundi
countries.funFact: The three stars in triangular configuration stand for the three ethnic groups of Burundi: the Hutu, the Twa and the Tutsi. The three stars also stand for the three elements of the national motto: Unité, Travail, Progrès ('Unity, Work and Progress'), which can be seen on the coat of arms of Burundi.

countries.name: Cambodia
countries.funFact: Cambodia's flag is the only one in the world to feature a building.

countries.name: Cameroon
countries.funFact: Before World War I, the vast majority of the country was a German colony. At that time it was known as Kamerun.

countries.name: Canada
countries.funFact: Canada is a monarchy, which is Elizabeth II.

countries.name: Cabo Verde
countries.funFact: Cabo Verde is an archipelago, that was uninhabited until the 15th century. Portuguese explorers colonised the islands in 1456, establishing the first European settlement in the tropics. Cape Verde only gained independence in 1975, which is why Portuguese is still the official spoken language across the archipelago.

countries.name: Cayman Islands
countries.funFact: As the Cayman Islands is a British Overseas Territory, driving is on the left-hand side of the road.

countries.name: Central African Republic
countries.funFact: The Central African Republic is home to the ethnic group of Pygmy people, known for their short stature - typically under five feet tall.

countries.name: Chad
countries.funFact: Chad is the largest of the 16 landlocked countries in Africa.

countries.name: Chile
countries.funFact: At 4,270 km (2,653 mi), Chile is the second longest country in the world, only narrowly being beat out by Brazil, which is 95 kilometers longer.

countries.name: China
countries.funFact: Put all of China’s railway lines, it can loop around the earth two times!

countries.name: Christmas Island
countries.funFact: Captain William Mynors of the Royal Mary, an English East India Company vessel, named the island when he sailed past it on Christmas Day, in 1643.

countries.name: Cocos (Keeling) Islands
countries.funFact: 'Cocos' references the vast crops of coconuts growing there. 'Keeling' is the surname of the founder of the islands, William Keeling.

countries.name: Colombia
countries.funFact: It is mandatory for radio and public television in Colombia to play the national anthem every day at 6 am and 6 pm.

countries.name: Comoros
countries.funFact: Someone attempts a coup in Comoros every 2 years.

countries.name: Congo
countries.funFact: Oil accounts for 89% of all Congo's exports.

countries.name: Congo (Democratic Republic of the)
countries.funFact: The Democratic Republic of the Congo's capital, Kinshasa, is the largest French-speaking city in the world (even above Paris).

countries.name: Cook Islands
countries.funFact: The official currency in the Cook Islands is New Zealand Dollar.

countries.name: Costa Rica
countries.funFact: Costa Rica doesn’t have a military.

countries.name: Croatia
countries.funFact: Croatia’s town of Hum, often referred to as the smallest town in the world.

countries.name: Cuba
countries.funFact: Cuba is the largest island in the Caribbean.

countries.name: Curaçao
countries.funFact: As a Netherlands overseas territory, Curaçao citizens hold the same rights to live and work in the EU as the Dutch.

countries.name: Cyprus
countries.funFact: According to the Greek Mythology, Cyprus is the birthplace of the Greek goddess of love, Aphrodite.

countries.name: Czechia
countries.funFact: Czech people are the world’s heaviest consumers of beer. On average, they drink 188.6 litres of beer per capita.

countries.name: Denmark
funFact: As of 2022, Denmark is the world second happiest country.
Denmark's flag, containing a red background and a white nordic cross, is the oldest flag currently in use. Its first documented use was in 1219, in the battle of Lyndanisse

countries.name: Djibouti
countries.funFact: At 155m below sea level, Lac Assal, in Djibouti is the lowest point in Africa.

countries.name: Dominica
countries.funFact: Dominica is one of only 2 countries to have purple on its flag.

countries.name: Dominican Republic
countries.funFact: The first cathedral, hospital, and university in the Americas were founded in what is now Dominican Republic capital city, Santo Domingo.

countries.name: Ecuador
countries.funFact: Ecuador's name comes from the Spanish word for the equator, which the country straddles it.

countries.name: Egypt
countries.funFact: Egyptians were the inventors of the 365-day calender. They subdivided the year into 3 seasons.

countries.name: El Salvador
funFact: El Salvador is known as the “Land of the Volcanoes” because of the more than 20 volcanoes in the territory. It even has volcanoes in its flag.
El Salvador became the first country in the world to use Bitcoin as legal tender, after having been adopted as such by the Legislative Assembly of El Salvador in 2021.

countries.name: Equatorial Guinea
countries.funFact: The current capital of Equatorial Guinea is Malabo, which is located on the island of Bioko, and not the mainland. So, the government of this country is planning a new capital known as Oyala and is located in the Wele-Nzas province of the mainland region

countries.name: Eritrea
countries.funFact: Eritrea has no official language.

countries.name: Estonia
countries.funFact: Estonia has most start-ups per capita in Europe.

countries.name: Ethiopia
countries.funFact: Ethiopia was never colonised by the Europeans.

countries.name: Falkland Islands (Malvinas)
countries.funFact: Sovereignty over the Falkland Islands (Spanish: Islas Malvinas) is disputed by Argentina and the United Kingdom.

countries.name: Faroe Islands
countries.funFact: The Faroe Islands are devoid of trees. The ones that originally existed were probably cut by the first settlers and were never replanted.

countries.name: Fiji
countries.funFact: Fiji is one of the few nations to have three official languages, English, Fijian, and Fiji Hindi.

countries.name: Finland
countries.funFact: Finland is the world's happiest country.

countries.name: France
countries.funFact: Thanks to French Guiana, France's largest border is with Brazil

countries.name: French Guiana
countries.funFact: Although French Guiana is in South America, its currency is the Euro.

countries.name: French Polynesia
countries.funFact: It is believed that the word “tattoo” comes from the Tahitian (French Polynesian) word tatau and dates as far back as 1500 B.C.

countries.name: French Southern Territories
countries.funFact: The French Southern Territories has no permanently settled inhabitants.

countries.name: Gabon
countries.funFact: The name Gabon comes from the Portuguese word “gabao” meaning “cloak”. Early explorers thought the estuary of the Komo River by the capital of Libreville was the shape of a cloak.

countries.name: Gambia
funFact: With an area of only 4,300 square miles (11,500 square kilometers), The Gambia is the smallest nation in mainland Africa
The Gambia is one of only a few countries to have a 'The' behind their name. This is due to the fact that its name originates from the Gambia river.

countries.name: Georgia
countries.funFact: The Georgian language is one of the most unique languages in the world and boasts its own alphabet.

countries.name: Germany
countries.funFact: There are more football fan clubs in Germany than anywhere else in the world.

countries.name: Ghana
countries.funFact: Ghana is the second-largest producer of gold in Africa. In fact, before 1957, Ghana was commonly known as the Gold Coast because of its availability of gold along the rivers Ankobra and Volta.

countries.name: Gibraltar
countries.funFact: There is basically no tax on goods in Gibraltar. This includes cigarettes, booze, etc.

countries.name: Greece
countries.funFact: Greece has more archaeological museums and theatres than any country in the world.

countries.name: Greenland
countries.funFact: Greenland has the most northerly capital city in the world - Nuuk.

countries.name: Grenada
countries.funFact: Christopher Columbus discovered the island in 1498 and named it Concepcion. A year after that, another bunch of explorers passed by the island and changed the name to Mayo. When the French came, they changed it to “Le Grenade” and finally when the British took over, they called it Grenada.

countries.name: Guadeloupe
countries.funFact: In fact, Columbus was also the first European to see Guadeloupe! He landed there in 1493, and gave the island its name: “Santa María de Guadalupe”. The region was designated as a shrine to the Virgin Mary, venerated in Guadalupe, a Spanish town in Extremadura.

countries.name: Guam
countries.funFact: 'Where the American day begins' is the most popular slogan of Guam as this island is the first place where the sun rises on American soil.

countries.name: Guatemala
countries.funFact: Guatemala is best known as the birthplace of the Mayan civilisation and many of its ancient traditions are present across the country.

countries.name: Guernsey
funFact: Guernsey is located in the English Channel, just off the coast of Normandy, France. The official languages of Guernsey are both English and Guernésiais, and despite being a territory of the UK, Guernsey Pound is the official currency of Guernsey.
Guernsey is located in the English Channel, just off the coast of Normandy, France. 'Les Misérables' was written by Victor Hugo whilst living in Guernsey.

countries.name: Guinea
countries.funFact: Guinea is also known as Guinea-Conakry in order to distinction it from the neighboring nations of Equatorial Guinea and Guinea-Bissau, which all contain the word 'Guinea' in their name.

countries.name: Guinea-Bissau
countries.funFact: Portuguese is the official language of Guinea-Bissau, because it used to be a portugese colony.

countries.name: Guyana
countries.funFact: Guyana is the 'Land of Many Water(falls)'. The world's widest and longest single-drop waterfall is located on Guyana's Potaro River in the Kaieteur National Park.

countries.name: Haiti
countries.funFact: Haiti and Canada are the only countries in the Americas with French as an official language.

countries.name: Heard Island and McDonald Islands
funFact: Despite being located between South Africa and Antarctica, Heard And Mcdonald Islands are actually a part of Australia

The first recorded sighting of the Heard Island was in 1853 by Captain John Heard. The island was named after him. Soon later, in 1854, William McDonald located the second largest island, documented it, and named it after himself.

countries.name: Vatican City
countries.funFact: Not only the Vatican City is smallest country in the world, it's the only county that uses Latin as its official language.

countries.name: Honduras
countries.funFact: Honduras's name translates to “great depths” in Spanish. It was named by Christopher Columbus after the deep waters along the coast.

countries.name: Hungary
countries.funFact: The ancient Hungarians originated from the Ural region in today's central Russia and migrated across the Eastern European steppe, until they settled in today's Hungary.

countries.name: Hong Kong
countries.funFact: Hong Kong is so rich it has more Rolls Royces per capita than any other city in the world

countries.name: Iceland
countries.funFact: Between 30% and 40% of Icelanders will not deny the existence of elves. Icelandic folklore is still rich with stories about the Huldufólk, meaning 'hidden people', who are said to live in the lava fields on the island.

countries.name: India
countries.funFact: India is set to surpass China as the world's most populous country in 2023, with an expected population of about 1.4 billion people.

countries.name: Indonesia
countries.funFact: Indonesia is the largest Muslim nation in the world, and it spreads across the 2nd, 3rd and, 6th and 13th biggest islands in the world.

countries.name: Ivory Coast
countries.funFact: Ivory Coast is the largest producer of cocoa beans in the world.

countries.name: Iran (Islamic Republic of)
countries.funFact: Iran has its own calendar, which is a solar calendar, meaning that its time reckoning is based on the Earth's movements around the Sun.

countries.name: Iraq
countries.funFact: Iraq is home to the world's oldest civilisation.

countries.name: Ireland
countries.funFact: Iraq is considered the birthplace of Abraham.

countries.name: Isle of Man
countries.funFact: The island's language is Manx, otherwise known as Manx Gaelic, is an ancient language that originates from the islands Celtic past. It closely resembles that of Irish and Scottish Gaelic, but with a hint of Old Norse from when the Vikings came here.

countries.name: Israel
countries.funFact: Israel has more museums per capita than any other country in the world.

countries.name: Italy
countries.funFact: Italy is the only country to completely surround 2 countries, San Marino and Vatican.

countries.name: Jamaica
countries.funFact: The top three fastest men in the world are Jamaicans!

countries.name: Japan
countries.funFact: Japan is a highly ethnically homogenous country - 98.5% of the population is Japanese.

countries.name: Jersey
countries.funFact: Although Jersey's small size, it has one of the largest tides in the world. At low tide, twice a day, the island almost doubles in size.

countries.name: Jordan
countries.funFact: Unlike other Arab countries, Jordan does not have its own oil.

countries.name: Kazakhstan
countries.funFact: Kazakhstan provides over 50% of the world's supply of Uranium.

countries.name: Kenya
countries.funFact: Besides being home to the world’s best long-distance runners, the first woman to win a Nobel Peace Prize was from Kenya.

countries.name: Kiribati
countries.funFact: Kiribati has purchased 6,000 acres (24 sq km) of land in Fiji in case rising sea levels force the permanent evacuation of its residents.

countries.name: Kuwait
countries.funFact: The currency of Kuwait is the Kuwaiti dinar. It is the highest-valued currency unit per face value in the world.

countries.name: Kyrgyzstan
countries.funFact: Kyrgyzstan's flag contains 40 rays stand for the number of tribes united by Manas to fight against the Mongols. Manas is a 10th-century legendary hero of the Kyrgyz people, who value him as their sacred ancient forefather.

countries.name: Lao People's Democratic Republic
countries.funFact: The Laotians consume more sticky rice than anyone else in the world.

countries.name: Latvia
countries.funFact: A Latvian-Jewish tailor named Jākobs Jufess invented the jeans we all know, wear and cannot live without now. Levi Strauss backed him financially.

countries.name: Lebanon
countries.funFact: There are more Lebanese living outside Lebanon, than within the country. Most of Lebanese live in Brazil.

countries.name: Lesotho
countries.funFact: Lesotho is one of only 3 countries to be completely surrounded by another country. The other ones are Vatican and San Marino, both surrounded by Italy.

countries.name: Liberia
countries.funFact: Liberia is the first country in Africa which had a female president. Known as Africa’s Iron Lady, Ellen Johnson Sirleaf took office as Liberia’s 24th president in 2006. She also won the Nobel Peace Prize in 2011.

countries.name: Libya
countries.funFact: The last flag of Libya was a green field and was considered the only solid colour national flag in the world during its time.

countries.name: Liechtenstein
countries.funFact: Liechtenstein is a doubly landlocked country. It is surrounded by Switzerland and Austria, which in turn are also landlocked by other European countries, making it the second doubly landlocked country after Uzbekistan.

countries.name: Lithuania
countries.funFact: Lithuania is the only country to have a national scent.

countries.name: Luxembourg
countries.funFact: Luxembourg has the highest minimum wage in the EU. However, the cost of living in Luxembourg is one of the highest in the world.

countries.name: Macao
countries.funFact: Macao has the most densely populated region on earth.

countries.name: North Macedonia
countries.funFact: Macedonia chose its name as North Macedonia because of a dispute with Greece who claimed the country can't use the name 'Macedonia' that is considered part of Greek culture.

countries.name: Madagascar
countries.funFact: Although Madagascar is located in Africa, most of its ethnic groups are from a Malayo-Indonesian origin.

countries.name: Malawi
countries.funFact: Malawi's name originates from the bordering Lake Malawi.

countries.name: Malaysia
countries.funFact: Malaysia has a unique rotating monarchy system, in which nine ethnic Malay state rulers take turns as king for five-year terms.

countries.name: Maldives
countries.funFact: According to the constitution of Maldives, only Muslims are allowed to be called citizens of the country. Any other faith apart from Islam is not allowed.

countries.name: Mali
countries.funFact: Mansa Musa, Mali's king in the 14th century, is the richest man to ever live. He had so much gold that, on a trip to Cairo, he spent 71,000 pounds (32,000 kg) of gold.

countries.name: Malta
countries.funFact: The official language of Malta is Maltese, a Semitic language derived from late medieval Sicilian Arabic with Romance superstrata. It's the only official Semitic language of the European Union.

countries.name: Marshall Islands
countries.funFact: The islands are so narrow that you will have just one road running their length. No diversion, no shortcuts, you will have only one way to follow.

countries.name: Martinique
countries.funFact: Martinique has been continuously inhabited for 4000 years. The Arawak tribe first settled there, before being replaced by the Caribbean Indians.

countries.name: Mauritania
countries.funFact: Mauritania was the last country to abolish slavery, in 1981.

countries.name: Mauritius
countries.funFact: The Dodo bird, an extinct flightless bird, was endemic to Mauritius. It got extinct because it was hunted by sailors and by the invasive species they brought to the island, while its habitat was being destroyed. The last widely accepted sighting of a dodo was in 1662.

countries.name: Mayotte
countries.funFact: Mayotte is a group of islands under French sovereignty, near Comoros and Madagascar off the coast of Africa. Comoros, which used to be a French colony, sees Mayotte as a part of its territory, and doesn't recognize the French sovereignty on the islands

countries.name: Mexico
countries.funFact: Not Egypt, but Mexico is home to the world's largest pyramid. It is located in Cholula and its size is 984 by 1,033 ft (300 by 315 metres).

countries.name: Micronesia (Federated States of)
countries.funFact: Micronesia is one of just 22 countries not to have an army. Instead, as a former US-administered territory, the USA provides aid and is responsible for Micronesia's defence. In return, the USA can maintain military bases in Micronesia.

countries.name: Moldova (Republic of)
countries.funFact: With an army of only 5,150 soldiers, Moldova has one of the smallest armies in Europe.

countries.name: Monaco
countries.funFact: With an average life expectancy of 89.4, Monaco has the 2nd highest life expectancy

countries.name: Mongolia
countries.funFact: Mongolia's capital, Ulaanbaatar, is the world's coldest capital city. It has an average annual temperature of 30°F (about -1°C).

countries.name: Montenegro
countries.funFact: Montenegro declared its independence from Serbia on June 3, 2006, after being a part of Serbia and Montenegro since 1992, after Yoguslavia's dissolution.

countries.name: Montserrat
countries.funFact: Despite being a British island in the Carribbean, the island is named after Santa Maria de Montserrat Monastery, a Benedictine monastery locate on Montserrat, a Spanish mountain. It was discovered and named by Christopher Colombus in 1493.

countries.name: Morocco
countries.funFact: Morocco hosts the oldest continuously operating university in the world, Al-Qarawiyyin university, founded in 859 AD.

countries.name: Mozambique
countries.funFact: Mozambique is the only nation to feature a modern firearm on their flag. Its flag features an AK-47, also known as Kalashnikov.

countries.name: Myanmar
countries.funFact: In 2005, Yangon was the capital of Myanmar. The government built a new city named Naypyidaw in secret and then announced that it was the new cpaital city.

countries.name: Namibia
countries.funFact: Namibia is home to the world's oldest desert, the Namib Desert, existing for between 55 million and 80 million years.

countries.name: Nauru
countries.funFact: Nauru is the fattest state in the world. over 71% of the country's population is obese.

countries.name: Nepal
funFact: Nepal is home to mount Everest, the world's tallest mountain.
Nepal is the birthplace of Buddha.

countries.name: Netherlands
countries.funFact: The Netherlands was the first country to legalize same-sex marriage. The law came into effect on April 1, 2001.

countries.name: New Caledonia
countries.funFact: Surprisingly, there is no official language in New Caledonia, although French is the most widely-spoken language in the area. Aside from French, there are over 30 Melanesian dialects and languages spoken in the achipelago.

countries.name: New Zealand
countries.funFact: In addition to English and sign language, Maori is also an official language in New Zealand. 17% of the country's population is native Maori, the Indigenous people of New Zealand.

countries.name: Nicaragua
funFact: The Americas' First Elected Female Head Of State Is From Nicaragua. Violeta Chamorro served as the president of the country from April 25, 1990, to January 10, 1997.

Nicaragua is the only country in Latin America to be colonised by both the Spanish and the British. The Spanish conquest of the Nicaraguan territory took place in 1522. The British began colonising Nicaragua in 1633 and they controlled the area until 1860.

countries.name: Niger
countries.funFact: The country's name comes from the Niger river flowing through the country. The river's name possibly comes from the Berber word 'Gher', meaning river.

countries.name: Nigeria
countries.funFact: Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa, with a population of over 200 million people.

countries.name: Niue
funFact: There are more Niueans living outside of Niue than in Niue. Niue's population is around 1,600 residents, while a whopping 22,200 Niueans live in New Zealand.
Since more niueans live outside of the Niue than in it, Niuean is considered an endangered language, with only 7,00 native speakers.

countries.name: Korea (Democratic People's Republic of)
countries.funFact: Despite the popular opinion, drugs are actually common and unregulated in North Korea.

countries.name: Norway
countries.funFact: Norway has the most electric cars per capita in the world.

countries.name: Oman
countries.funFact: Oman is the oldest independent state in the Arab world. The ruling dynasty of Oman dates back to 1794, making it one of the oldest independent states in the Arab world. It was formerly a maritime empire. They gained independence from Portugal in 1650, a holiday that is still celebrated today.

countries.name: Pakistan
countries.funFact: Pakistan is the world's first Islamic country to attain nuclear power.

countries.name: Palau
countries.funFact: Palau has a lake packed with millions of jellyfish, that are not poisonous.

countries.name: Poland
countries.funFact: The Castle of the Teutonic Order, located in Poland, is the largest castle in the world.

countries.name: Republic of Kosovo
countries.funFact: Despite not being a part of the EU, Kosovo still uses the euro as its official currency.

countries.name: Saint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha
Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
countries.funFact: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines is a multi-island, southern Caribbean country. The native people of the islands may have been cannibals.

countries.name: Samoa
countries.funFact: Although only 78 miles (125 km) seperate between Samoa and its closest neighbor, American Samoa, since they are located on different sides of the International Date Line, almost 24 hours seperate between the islands.

countries.name: San Marino
countries.funFact: San Marino, a small country surrounded by Italy is the oldest surviving sovereign state and constitutional republic in the world. The official date of its founding is September 3, 301.

countries.name: Sao Tome and Principe
countries.funFact: Sao Tome and Principe is the second-smallest African country. The island of Sao Tome was named after Saint Thomas by the Portuguese explorers as they arrived here on Saint Thomas' day.

countries.name: Saudi Arabia
countries.funFact: Saudi Arabia is building the world's tallest skyscraper. The Kingdom Jeddah Tower, in the city of Jeddah which is currently on hold, will stand at least 3,280-feet tall once completed. That's almost 200 metres taller than the Burj Khalifa, which currently holds the title of the world's tallest free-standing structure.

countries.name: Senegal
countries.funFact: Senegal is home to the mainland's Africa westernmost point.

countries.name: Serbia
countries.funFact: Serbia is one of the world's biggest exporters of raspberries, and in the year 2012, Serbia was responsible for almost 95% of the world's raspberries!

countries.name: Seychelles
countries.funFact: Although being very close to the coast of Africa, these islands remained uninhabited until the French arrived to the island, in 1770.

countries.name: Sierra Leone
countries.funFact: The name Sierra Leone was adapted from the Portuguese name for the country: Serra Leoa. The literal meaning is 'Lioness Mountains.'

countries.name: Singapore
countries.funFact: Chewing gum is banned in Singapore. Only those with medical prescription can chew gum.

countries.name: Sint Maarten (Dutch part)
funFact: Sint Maarten encompasses the southern 44% of the divided island of Saint Martin, while the northern 56% of the island constitutes the French overseas collectivity of Saint Martin.
Sint Maarten most restaurants and beaches per square mile.

countries.name: Slovakia
countries.funFact: Slovakia is the world's highest number of castles per capita, 180 castles in the whole country.

countries.name: Slovenia
countries.funFact: Unlike the other countries that made up Yugoslavia in the past, in Slovenia there is ethnic uniformity to a large extent.

countries.name: Solomon Islands
countries.funFact: The world's largest raised coral atoll is East Rennell in the Solomon Islands. An atoll is a ring-shaped island, including a coral rim that encircles a lagoon partially or completely.

countries.name: Somalia
countries.funFact: Somalia sits in the Horn of Africa and has the Longest Coastline In Mainland Africa

countries.name: South Africa
countries.funFact: In the 1960s and 70s, South Africa possessed nuclear weapons. They were eventually dismantled in 1989.

countries.name: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
countries.funFact: It was the site of the southernmost battle ever fought. During the 1982 Falkland Islands War, Argentina sent troops to South Georgia, a British Overseas Territory.

countries.name: Korea (Republic of)
countries.funFact: South Korea Is Known As The Plastic Surgery Capital Of The World. Because of the rigid Korean beauty standards, undergoing cosmetic surgery is very common among Koreans.

countries.name: Spain
countries.funFact: In 1479, the Crown of Castile and the various territories of the Crown of Aragon were united in a personal union, creating for the first time since the 8th century a single political unit, referred to as España (Spain).

countries.name: Sri Lanka
countries.funFact: The oldest living tree known to be planted by man is in Sri Lanka. It is a sacred fig (also called a bo-tree), and it was planted in 288 BC, thus the tree is 2,300 years old.

countries.name: Sudan
funFact: Despites pyramids being synonymous with Egypt, Sudan has the world's most pyramids, even more than Egypt. Sudan has around 255 pyramids, while Egypt has only 188.
Prior to South Sudan's seperation from Sudan in 2011, Sudan used to be the largest country in Africa, with a total landmass of over 950,000 square miles (2.5 million square km).

countries.name: South Sudan
countries.funFact: South Sudan is the newest internationally recognized country in the world, which declared independence on July 9, 2011.

countries.name: Suriname
countries.funFact: Suriname is the smallest country in South America and its official language is Dutch.

countries.name: Svalbard and Jan Mayen
funFact: In Svalbard and Jan Mayen was the northernmost church in the world until 2017 when the St. Nicholas Russian Orthodox Church was built in Nagurskoye air force base in Russia.
Svalbard does not currently use a distinct flag and it actually uses Norway's flag.

countries.name: Kingdom of Eswatini
countries.funFact: In April 2018, the official name was changed from Kingdom of Swaziland to Kingdom of Eswatini, mirroring the name commonly used in Swazi. The government is an absolute monarchy, the last of its kind in Africa, and has been ruled by King Mswati III since 1986.

countries.name: Sweden
countries.funFact: The Nobel Prize is awarded every year in Sweden.

countries.name: Switzerland
countries.funFact: Despite their neutrality, until 2021, all bridges connecting Switzerland to the outside world have been planted with bombs, to be blown up in case of invasion.

countries.name: syrian Arab Republic
countries.funFact: Syria's capital, Damascus, is one of the world's oldest continuously inhabited cities.

countries.name: Taiwan
countries.funFact: Only 2.3% of the Taiwanese population is native The other 97.7% are ethnically Chinese. This is because Taiwan was ruled by the Qing Dynasty for 200 years. During this time, the locals were pushed out.

countries.name: Tajikistan
countries.funFact: Tajikistan has the world's largest glacier, outside of the poles. The glacier spans over 50 miles (80 km).

countries.name: Tanzania, United Republic of
countries.funFact: Mount Kilimanjaro, Africa's highest mountain, is in northeastern Tanzania.

countries.name: Thailand
countries.funFact: Thailand was previously known as Siam. The name was changed in 1939 to Thailand, which 'Land of the Free'.

countries.name: Timor-Leste
countries.funFact: Timor-Leste was the first nation to gain independence in the 21st century. They actually first became independent in 1975 but were invaded and occupied soon after.

countries.name: Togo
countries.funFact: The voodoo religion is practised widely in Togo.

countries.name: Tokelau
countries.funFact: The islands were first settled by Polynesian peoples about 1000 years ago, and it was not until 1889 that Tokelau became a British protectorate. Today it is a dependent territory of New Zealand.

countries.name: Tonga
countries.funFact: Tonga is a constitutional monarchy. It is the only remaining indigenous monarchy in the Pacific islands.

countries.name: Trinidad and Tobago
countries.funFact: The singer Nicki Minaj is originally from Trinidad and Tobago.

countries.name: Tunisia
countries.funFact: Tunisia is home to the northernmost point of Africa, Cape Angela (Ras Angela).

countries.name: Turkey
countries.funFact: The Turkish people were originally equestrian nomads from Northeast Asia.

countries.name: Turkmenistan
countries.funFact: Turkmenistan is a secretive Asian dictatorship that is stricter than North Korea, where the streets are paved with marble and gold.

countries.name: Turks and Caicos Islands
countries.funFact: The islands have gone through plenty of different owners. Currently, the British own the islands. However, the currency most commonly used on the islands, is the US dollar.

countries.name: Tuvalu
countries.funFact: Tuvalu's domain is .tv. Leasing the domain to people is now the largest source of income for this tiny island.

countries.name: Uganda
countries.funFact: Uganda is home to the 2nd largest fresh water lake in the world, Lake Victoria. The lake is also the source of the Nile River, the 2nd longest river in the world.

countries.name: Ukraine
countries.funFact: The UAE was the first country in the world to appoint a minister for artificial intelligence.

countries.name: United Arab Emirates
countries.funFact: The UAE was the first country in the world to appoint a minister for artificial intelligence.

countries.name: United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland
countries.funFact: The United Kingdom has owned the largest empire in history, the British Empire. At its peak, in 1920, the British controlled over 13 million square miles (35.5 million square km), which is 25% of the entire land area of Earth.

countries.name: United States of America
countries.funFact: Many recognize Washington, DC as the capital of the United States but that wasn't always the case. Washington didn’t become the capital until 1790. Believe it or not, from 1785 until 1790, New York City served as the countries capital.

countries.name: Uruguay
countries.funFact: The name Uruguay comes from the Guaraní (an Uruguay's indigenous language) word for the Uruguay River, which means either 'river where the bird lives', 'river of the painted birds', 'river of the snails', or 'winding river.'

countries.name: Uzbekistan
countries.funFact: Uzbekistan is one of only 2 double-landlocked countries. It is surrounded by Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Afghanistan and Turkmenistan, which are also landlocked, making it the second double-landlocked country after Liechtenstein.

countries.name: Vanuatu
countries.funFact: The national anthem of Vanuatu is in Bislama, one of Vanuatu 3 official languages, along with English and French and called 'Yumi, yumi, yumi.'. Yumi means 'we' in English.

countries.name: Venezuela (Bolivarian Republic of)
countries.funFact: With a proven 308 billion barrels, Venezuela has the world's largest oil reserves, even above Saudi Arabia.

countries.name: Vietnam
countries.funFact: Following the death of Vietnam's first president, Ho Chi Min, they put his body on public display.

countries.name: Wallis and Futuna
countries.funFact: As a French territory Wallis and Futuna celebrates Bastille Day on 14 July.

countries.name: Western Sahara
countries.funFact: Western Sahara, formerly the Spanish colony of Spanish Sahara, is a disputed territory claimed by both the Kingdom of Morocco and the Popular Front for the Liberation of the Saguia el Hamra and Rio de Oro (Polisario Front), which is an independence movement based in Algeria.

countries.name: Yemen
countries.funFact: Yemen has been in an on-going civil war since 2014, causing the death of over 350,000 people.

countries.name: Zambia
countries.funFact: Zambia is the home of the largest waterfall in the world, Victoria Falls. Its height is 108 meters, and its twice the size of Niagara Falls.

countries.name: Zimbabwe
countries.funFact: With 16 official languages, Zimbabwe is the country with the most official languages.
